name: L 98-59
scenarioDescription:
The L 98-59 Exoplanetary System


Overview

L 98-59 is a star with 0.31 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.31 times its radius. It is located 34.63776719999999 light years away from the solar system.

L 98-59 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the L 98-59 system

L 98-59 b

L 98-59 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the Transit method. The mass of L 98-59 b is 1.01 times the mass of Earth. The radius of L 98-59 b is 0.8 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, L 98-59 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.


L 98-59 c

L 98-59 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the Transit method. The mass of L 98-59 c is 2.42 times the mass of Earth. The radius of L 98-59 c is 1.35 that of Earth. At 2.42 Earth masses, L 98-59 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


L 98-59 d

L 98-59 d was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the Transit method. The mass of L 98-59 d is 2.31 times the mass of Earth. The radius of L 98-59 d is 1.57 that of Earth. At 2.31 Earth masses, L 98-59 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system L 98-59, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
